intro: Chloraea apinnula, commonly known as the narrow-leaved greenbottle, is a flowering plant native to southeastern Australia. It belongs to the family Rutaceae, which includes citrus plants, and is characterized by its small, greenish-yellow flowers. The plant has narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in a fine, white powdery coating. It typically grows in open woodland or heathland, preferring well-drained soils. Chloraea apinnula is known for its unique seed pods that split open to release seeds, aiding in its propagation.
